location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: ‘Tribal and Communications Map of Area No 13 (‘Arabistan)’

physicalDescription.extent: A contents list at the front of the volume (ff 4-5) and an index at the rear (ff 171-177) reference the volume’s printed pagination sequence.
Dimensions:724 x 600 mm, on sheet 784 x 657 mm.Materials:printed in colour on paper.

mods.abstract: Map of Arabistan [Khūzestān], produced at the Survey of India Offices, Calcutta [Kolkota], indicating: hydrography in blue, including lands liable to flooding; terrain in brown; roads as red lines; telegraph lines; settlements; tribal areas, annotated with red capitals; the Persian-Iraq boundary as a solid black line; the boundary of Arabistan as a black dash-dotted line; Anglo-Persian Oil Company stations; landing grounds. A note in the bottom left corner of the map reads: ‘Compiled from Million Sheet & India & Adjacent Countries’.
